Key Match Events: The Yankees lost Game 2 of the ALDS to the Royals with a score of 4-2.
Jazz Chisholm Jr. hit a solo home run in the ninth inning of Game 2.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees had a strong regular season with their hitters rampaging through the American League.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm Jr. expressed confidence in the team's ability to win the series.
Aaron Judge expressed disappointment about the loss but noted that it motivated the team.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees had several hard-hit balls that went for outs.
Aaron Judge hit a fly ball to right in the third inning that was measured at 98.1 mph off the bat but was a simple 322-foot fly out.
Others: Aaron Judge is under intense scrutiny this postseason as a star who has had past playoff duds.
Giancarlo Stanton is struggling at the plate, going 1-for-8 in the series.
